meanings.sent1: I always misplan my study schedule and end up cramming the night before the exam.
meanings.sent2: She tends to misplan her vacations, forgetting important details like booking accommodation.
meanings.sent3: After I misplan my grocery shopping, I come home with everything except what I actually needed.
meanings.sent4: Trying to misplan your way through life is like trying to navigate a maze blindfolded.
meanings.sent5: Don't misplan your route or you might get lost in the unfamiliar city.

meanings.definition: A plan that has been made incorrectly or poorly.
meanings.sent1: His misplan for the project caused delays and confusion among the team members.
meanings.sent2: The misplan to hold the event outdoors without checking the weather led to a disaster.
meanings.sent3: The misplan to surprise her with a cake ended up with it falling on the floor instead.
meanings.sent4: Their misplan was like a ship sailing without a compass, destined to veer off course.
meanings.sent5: The misplan to build the house on a slope resulted in constant drainage issues.
